resources.string: Show additional reboot options in power menu
Shut off pixels to reduce power consumption
Use Smart Pixels when battery saver is enabled
Prevent burn-in by shifting pixels every

Smart Pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see a significant improvement in battery life. For a good user experience, we recommend setting the amount of disabled pixels to 75 percent while shifting every 10 minutes.
Swipe 3 fingers down the screen to take a screenshot
When the screen is off, long-pressing power button will enable torch
Now you can use your face to unlock your phone or verify it’s you, like when you sign in to apps or approve a purchase
Fit your face in the inner frame
Do you want to set up Face Unlock without requiring your eyes to be open? If you set up this way, someone can unlock your phone by pointing it at your face when you’re not aware.
Hold the phone still. Rotate your head. Go slow.
Turn your head toward the arrow
To improve performance, you can set up Face Unlock again in Settings
Try fast setup instead. Keep in mind, your head may need to be more directly in front of your phone when using Face Unlock.\n\nTo improve performance, you can set up Face Unlock again in Settings.
Face Unlock setup can’t be completed because the phone is too hot. Try again later when the phone cools down.

Do you want to provide droidfood feedback for Face Unlock? We need data from a diverse set of users using the feature in real-world scenarios to make sure our Face Unlock works equally well for all our users.\n\nIf you volunteer to participate, data collected from unlock attempts (e.g. facial imagery) will be made available in the preinstalled Overlay data collection app. Your facial imagery data will be uploaded to and shared with Google ONLY upon your review and explicit consent in the Overlay app. Model performance metadata from unlock attempts will be collected via Android metrics.
